[REDACTED] consent is necessary for sharing pseudonymized data and participant identity information. [REDACTED] issues can prevent openly sharing the pseudonymized data, ask via your PRET application if in doubt whether sharing data violates privacy rights. Note the difference between the raw personal data, pseudonymized data and anonymized data. [REDACTED] data are personal data that have been processed in such a way that they can no longer directly be linked to a specific data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and is subject to technical and organisational measures to ensure that the personal data are not attributed to an identified or identifiable natural person. [REDACTED] data are not personal data. [REDACTED] data are data that do not relate to an identified or identifiable natural person or to personal data anonymised in such a manner that the data subject is not or no longer identifiable (by anyone or in any way).
